summary: This document is a collection of Bureau of Prisons administrative records from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York, dated August 1, 2019. It includes inmate count sheets, out-count forms, and inmate rosters, which are standard prison operational documents. The significance lies in the date, which is the day after Jeffrey Epstein's death, and the records show his inmate status and the general prison population counts and movements on that day.

events.title: Prison Administrative Counts and Rosters
events.description: Routine prison administrative activities including inmate counts, out-counts (tracking inmates outside their housing units), and roster updates at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, 150 Park Row, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein (Register Number 76318-054) is listed on an inmate roster dated August 1, 2019, with an assignment code 'ATTY' (attorney) and housing unit 'Z04-206LAD'.
The documents are dated August 1, 2019, which is the day after Epstein was found dead in his cell on July 31, 2019.
Several inmates (Miller, Bang, Duncan, Tisdale) are noted with assignments or codes indicating 'SUICIDE OR', which likely refers to suicide observation or watch status.
The documents are standard Bureau of Prisons operational forms (count sheets, out-count forms, inmate rosters) showing the routine population management at MCC New York.
Epstein's listing on an 'ATTY' assignment roster suggests administrative records were still being processed or updated after his death.
